alice.goal: Find the earliest 30-minute time slot on Tuesday, Oct 21 when Alice, Bob and Carol are all available.

private_information: Preference: minimize interruption to my morning schedule if multiple slots are possible
bob.goal: Find the earliest 30-minute time slot on Tuesday, Oct 21 when Alice, Bob and Carol are all available; prefer options that minimize interruption to Bob's morning schedule.

carol.goal: Find the earliest 30-minute time slot on Tuesday, Oct 21 when Alice, Bob and Carol are all available.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent availability reports and produce a PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward solver that finds the earliest 30-minute meeting slot on Tuesday, Oct 21 when all three participants are available, breaking ties to minimize interruption to Bob's morning.

public_information: Three colleagues (Alice, Bob, Carol) need to schedule a 30-minute meeting on Tuesday, Oct 21.
Find the earliest 30-minute slot when all three are available.
If multiple slots satisfy availability, choose the one that minimizes interruption to Bob's morning schedule.

report_availability.system_prompt: You are Alice. You know your own availability. Provide a concise, structured list of your available time intervals for Tuesday, Oct 21. Do not produce PDDL. Use the format: ['HH:MM-HH:MM', ...].

You are Bob. You know your own availability and preferences. Provide a concise, structured list of your available time intervals for Tuesday, Oct 21. Do not produce PDDL. Use the format: ['HH:MM-HH:MM', ...].
You are Carol. You know your own availability. Provide a concise, structured list of your available time intervals for Tuesday, Oct 21. Do not produce PDDL. Use the format: ['HH:MM-HH:MM', ...].

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent scheduling and PDDL modeling. Using the availability reports from the three agents, produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownward planner that will find the earliest 30-minute meeting slot on Tuesday, Oct 21 when all participants are available. Model time slots with the provided granularity, encode the meeting duration (30 minutes), and include tie-breaking to minimize interruption to Bob's morning schedule. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent actions and identities distinct where relevant.
